Package api

Class AbstractGame

java.lang.Object
api.AbstractGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
Game
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicGame, SampleGame
public abstract class AbstractGame extends Object implements Game
A partial implementation of the Game interface for Tetris-like falling shape games. Subclasses must implement the method determinePositionsToCollapse().

    • getPositionsToCollapse

      public List<Position> getPositionsToCollapse()
      Description copied from interface: Game
      Returns the grid positions to be collapsed. This method can only be called when the game state is COLLAPSING. The returned list is has no duplicates and is ordered according to the compareTo method of the Position class. (The purpose of this method is to allow clients to apply special rendering or animation to the collapsing positions.)
      Specified by:
      getPositionsToCollapse in interface Game
      Returns:
      list of Position objects representing the the grid positions to be collapsed

    • transform

      public boolean transform()
      Description copied from interface: Game
      Performs a transform() operation on the current piece if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
      Specified by:
      transform in interface Game
      Returns:
      true if the current piece was moved, false otherwise

    • step

      public GameStatus step()
      Description copied from interface: Game
      Transition the game through one discrete step. A step may consist of
      • shifting the current piece down by one cell
      • changing the status to COLLAPSING when when the current shape cannot be dropped further and completes a collapsible set (e.g., in a standard Tetris game, a collapsible set would be a completed horizontal row)
      • changing the status to STOPPED when the current piece cannot be dropped further, but does not complete a collapsible set
      • changing the status to NEW_SHAPE when a new piece is started at the top of the grid
      • deleting all cells to be collapsed
      • changing the status to GAME_OVER when a new piece collides with occupied positions in the top row
      Specified by:
      step in interface Game
      Returns:
      the game status after the step

    • collapsePositions

      public int collapsePositions(List<Position> positionsToCollapse)
      Deletes the icons at the indicated positions and shifts icons above them down. Only icons lying within a column above a deleted icon are shifted down. This method does not update the game state and should normally be called only from the step() method.
      Parameters:
      positionsToCollapse - list of positions to collapse, may contain duplicates.
      Returns:
      number of icons actually collapsed
